review:
You might have a hard time getting to run this now, but I remember the times I played this on CD way back in the 2006 era. Man.. I'm old now.

Anyway, it is a good game for some naval combat.
baştan sonar sistemini anlamak zor ama ilerde çok eğlenceli oluyor

Simply the best and only modern submarine simulator available on the market. There are no other games that offer the true challenge of being the commander of a vessel whose main purpose is situational awareness. You need to know how to play it, there are many bugs, but just as many mods that can enhance the experience.

Lamentablemente es un juego que ya está muy viejo, tiene muchos problemas de compatibilidad y la realidad es que hay mejores sustitutos. Si bien el launcher tiene 103 minutos abiertos, lo habre jugado unas 12 hs y puedo confirmar que no lo recomiendo, fue muy realista y bueno en su epoca, pero hoy el Command Modern Operations con el Tac View ofrece mejores gráficas y más realismo para el mismo propósito de este juego. Si uno lo juega en modo Arcade, entonces el SEA POWER es realmente un mejor juego.

En su época habrá sido genial, hoy ya está muy viejo.

Багато особливостей які можуть здатись багом. Наприклад одній з торпед човна класу "Лос-Анджелес", треба зменшити швидкість на 10 вузлів щоб вона наводилась, а не проходила повз. Ніби й логічно, а ніби й бісить бо нащо тоді та швидкість, лякати риб?
No need words , the best naval sea game
Yes.
doesn't open says I played 26 hrs never played at all?

I like that game. Graphics are not the best and I acutally had trouble running it on Windows 11. But it works now on Linux via Proton! Its very technical with all the station and all that but its fun. I think its one of the best naval sims out there.

As others have mentioned, this is a PIA to get to work on Windows 10. I tried following guides and could not get the game to start without crashing, so waste of money. Don't pay attention to those brushing it off as if it takes no effort to get this working on a newer computer - after a long time following guides and searching for solutions, I still couldn't get it working.

Pretty good, but buggy.
My hours are likely to stay forever 27, as after I open the game it doesnt say im playing, even though the game is running.

Um jogo de 2006 que parece ser de 1995 e que envelheceu muito mal.

Os gráficos são bem feios, as vezes é dificil saber o que está acontecendo.

O jogo não tem tutorial. Você precisa ler apostilas para entender. 

O mais importante: O jogo não funciona. Você precisa de alguns 'hacks' para conseguir fazer funcional. Eu só coinsegui fazer funcionar no Linux.

O  jogo NÃO devia estar a venda nesse estado. Ainda mais por $50!
Old school perfection.. A must have for the Die Hard enthusiast.

Might require some tweaking to get this to run on a modern system, but if you like the concept of Sea Power or Cold Waters yet find their simulational aspect too shallow (he he), definitely give Dangerous Waters a try. It's a much deeper (ho ho) game, though without a dynamic campaign.
Dangerous Waters까지  찾아오셨군요. 이 게임에 흥미가 있으시면 Cold Waters도 해보세요.
YES

I struggled and googled how to get it working on Windows 10. I got it working. I also got the extensions to work and now I don't dare to download it anymore :D But there's nothing to do, it's the best naval battle simulator so far and there's no better one yet. As long as nothing is done to beat it, I'll keep using it

It's a fun way to practice, learn or refresh your typing skills. Love this game. Come back to it all the time.

Makes learning to type fun for the whole family, My 6 and & year old Grandchildren are now learning to type instead of hunting and pecking. They hate the jelly fish though. We now have added to our school curriculum. now if we could just get reader rabbit back.
good to practice typing for rage typing in game

One of Popcap's old classics. Typer Shark is both a fun, challenging game and a rather good typing tutor.
The game has excellent word variety, making full use of the breadth of the English language, and adding names on top of that. The game has a surprisingly well made and extensive typing tutor mode that is excellent for teaching people how to type properly using all their fingers on a standard American QWERTY keyboard. The game will also recommend which difficulty level for you to play at based on your typing tutor scores.
The game itself also has good replayability, with an adventure mode that has various different difficulties and routes, and an abyss mode that is endless and slowly increases in difficulty. The different adventure mode routes contain different enemies, so it is definitely worth trying them all out.
Very highly recommended. You cannot go wrong with this one. Especially considering you can often buy this for a dollar or less during sales. Though the game is certainly worth the normal price of five dollars. An essential title for anyone who enjoys the golden age of Popcap Games.
Good but it's old and broken. Game resets everytime you close it
this is a very nosytal;gic and fun game learning to type is a balst
type type type tpyyee type type

You guys might have a hard time imagining that I played with this as a kid to practice typing in English, and yes, that was when I was preschool age, and I miss every day of it then.

I really miss that time.
Classic learn to type game. Better versions are out there but this one feels straight from the 90s. 7/10

I have used this game on multiple different platforms over the years to hone in my typing skills or to brush up on them when I'm feeling just a little rusty. I highly recommend Typer Shark Deluxe to anyone who is either starting to learn to type or even those who just want to brush up on their skills.
Very fun typing game my pinky hurts now even as I type this review. But maybe if you play this game you will also write your review super fast with a hurt pinky :)

Nostalgic
this game was so good i ascended up to heaven and more i felt like gabriel from utrakill
In my opinion, this game allows you to try to harden your writing skills without looking keyboard in fun way more than just typing the text on your computer.
VERY GOOD

Great for practice if you're already good with typing!
This game is just as fun as it used to be playing it in a web browser back in school! Easily a classic and must have for anyone that is a semi decent fan of anything typing related :)
Blast from the past. Used to love playing this in school. I've got my kids playing it now to help them on their typing.

Это всё та же Darwinia, только с уклоном в мультиплеер и отсутствие сюжета.
Но в отличие от демоверсии Darwinia, Multiwinia играется дольше. Один-три уровня на четыре типа игры.
Играть против компьютера в Multiwinia на нормальной сложности уже не просто, как это было в Darwinia (на высокой сложности уже молчу).
Но баги у него всё же присутствуют.

[b][i]-Педя Мох[/i][/b]
i have no idea what this she but i want to make babies with her

I seriously thought there was a standard that games should meet before anyone (especially the developer) deems it worthy of being called a game at all..
This game does not meet that standard. It was just terrible.

The game mechanics are a good representation of D&D3.5 for the most part, except it could have used the original NWN's system for customizing "armor". The stories for the campaigns are interesting. I have played through the primary campaign enough times to have forgotten how many times. The game is a couple decades old so the graphics could use some love.
it was fun

very good game
One of the best RPGs for me
Start off as a farmer, possibly end the game killing off several gods.

Лучшая игра среди всех RPG на базе D&D. Сюжет, проработка правил, вариативность прохождения.. Учитывая год выхода (2006 основная кампания), это было творение десятилетия. Всем, до сих пор не соприкоснувшимся с этой легендой - настоятельно рекомендую.

А DLC, по крайней мере "Маска предателя" - вообще заслуживает отдельных похвал. Сюжет держит в напряжении до самого финала, возможность развить персонажа из основной компании до 30, а за раскрытие историй бывших сопартийцев, отдельное спасибо Obsidian.
Not as good as the first Neverwinter Nights, but still a fun game if you can get it to work. Heaps of replay potential thanks to the modules out there
probably one of the greatest games of all time.

i liked the customization of this game, and the story was pretty cool too

Great game. Has replay value. Can be somewhat clunky, but it's still fun. Just like the loading screen says. Save often, and always keep multiple saves. I just spent ten hours or so, only to have both my saves corrupted. SAVE OFTEN AND HAVE MULTIPLE!

Everyone keeps complaining about the camera, but it's not a big issue when you get used to it.
The plot of the OC is nothing special and that squeaky tiefling is one of the most chokable characters in any DnD game, along with "Deekin" from NWN1 expansion. The gameplay itself is not the most thoughtful form of interaction you could have with the genre. But you just have to keep everyone on their feet and blast some AoE spells that don't even inflict friendly fire. Play through the shit show OC or MotB, which is not the Citizen Kane of rpg games but how the lore and story intertwined made it feel almost biblical.
